intro: Descurainia hartwegiana, commonly known as Hartweg's tansy, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many mustard species, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and slender, hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cold, high-altitude environments. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Descurainia hartwegiana is often found in tundra and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems.
